I just wanted to express my extreme dissapointment and sadness over the fact that The West Wing will be ending this coming Sunday.emoticon_cry 
 It's especially dissappointing knowing the last few years could have been so much better if Aaron Sorkin and Thomas Schlamme were still with the show.
 
 The upside is that the team is developing a new show "Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip." I can't wait for it.

I will miss it also. I note that with the new president, Allison Janney (P.J.) would no longer be the tallest cast member.
 Dono

I will miss it also. I note that with the new president, Allison Janney (P.J.) would no longer be the tallest cast member.
 Dono

 Good point :) 
 
 Thank God for Bravo reruns and TV to DVD.
 
 P.S. (Not to be rude or sound snooty, but it's CJ)

I guess I'm one of the people whose fault this is.
 
 I used to watch the show faithfully, but the last year or so, with the new president, and the loss of Leo, and other cast members, I've drifted away and lost interest.
 
 It was a great show at its peak. Actually challenged the mind while watching TV.
 
 Waxy

I guess I'm one of the people whose fault this is.
 
 I used to watch the show faithfully, but the last year or so, with the new president, and the loss of Leo, and other cast members, I've drifted away and lost interest.
 
 It was a great show at its peak. Actually challenged the mind while watching TV.
 
 Waxy

 That's not your fault. That's NBC's fault. They got rid of Aaron Sorkin and it was all downhill from there. Not that it hasn't been a good show since then or that it's had its moments, but it hasn't had the greatness it once had. Except for the loss of Leo. NBC couldn't really help that.
 
 You're right. It did change the mind and challenge you to think. I miss that.
 
 Thankfully, Aaron Sorkin and Thomas Schlamme are developing a new show called "Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip." It's going to have several of the West Wing cast members including Bradley Whitford as the lead. I just wish they had brought the woman that plays Donna along too.
Is it set in the same 'universe' as the West Wing, or are they just using actors they have got to know and like rather than the same characters?

Is it set in the same 'universe' as the West Wing, or are they just using actors they have got to know and like rather than the same characters?

 They're just using some of the same actors, not the same characters. It's a drama about running a sketch comedy show.
